member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverterResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a document conversion.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverterResult.OutputFiles
member.summary: Gets the paths of the converted document files. When there is only one output file, the value will be a single item array. If the output is a directory (e.g. for format), the string will have a trailing backslash (\).

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverterResult.ElapsedTime
member.summary: Gets the total elapsed time for the document conversion.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement
member.summary: Defines the document engine enforcement options.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement.Auto
member.summary: Either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement.ForceNative
member.summary: Force conversion via native document engine. The native document engine is usually faster but it supports a limited set of document formats.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement.ForceManaged
member.summary: Force conversion via managed document engine. The managed document engine supports wide range of document formats.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineSupport
member.summary: Defines the document engine support for document formats.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineSupport.None
member.summary: The document format should be not supported by any document engine.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineSupport.Native
member.summary: The document format should be supported by native document engine. The native document engine is usually faster but it supports a limited set of document formats.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineSupport.Managed
member.summary: The document format should be supported by managed document engine. The managed document engine supports wide range of document formats.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineSupport.Both
member.summary: The document format should be supported by both native and managed document engines.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineSupport.Either
member.summary: The document format should be supported by either native or managed document engine.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineType
member.summary: Defines the document engine types.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineType.Native
member.summary: The document format is supported by the native document engine. The native document engine is usually faster but it supports a limited set of document formats.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineType.Managed
member.summary: The document format is supported by the managed document engine. The managed document engine supports wide range of document formats.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineType.Both
member.summary: The document format is supported by both native and managed document engines.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark
member.summary: Represents a set of image watermark options used for document conversion.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a image stream.
member.param: The image stream to use as the watermark. The stream will be disposed automatically after it's used.

The version of the image stream, only useful when the watermark is used with DocumentViewer. As the image source is not on disk, information like file date and size will not be available for unique cache key calculation so you can make DocumentViewer know that you changed the source image by manually incrementing this version value. This way DocumentViewer can recognize the change, invalidate the cached document and force watermarking with new image. Instead of incrementing, you can also pass some kind of hash or DateTime.Ticks as the parameter type is a long number, of course the value should only change when the image is actually changed.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a instance.
member.param: The bitmap to use as the watermark. The bitmap will be disposed automatically after it's used.

The version of the image bitmap, only useful when the watermark is used with DocumentViewer. As the image source is not on disk, information like file date and size will not be available for unique cache key calculation so you can make DocumentViewer know that you changed the source image by manually incrementing this version value. This way DocumentViewer can recognize the change, invalidate the cached document and force watermarking with new image. Instead of incrementing, you can also pass some kind of hash or DateTime.Ticks as the parameter type is a long number, of course the value should only change when the image is actually changed.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.ImageFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the image file to use as the watermark.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange
member.summary: Represents a range of page numbers.
member.remarks:
The range is specified as a string in the following forms or combination thereof:
5 single value 1,2,3,4,5 sequence of values 1-5 closed range -5 open range (converted to a sequence from 1 to 5) 1- open range (converted to a sequence from 1 to final page) all keyword representing all page numbers. odd keyword representing odd page numbers. even keyword representing even page numbers.
The value delimiter can be either ',' or ';' and the range separator can be either '-' or ':'. Whitespace is permitted at any point in the input.
Any elements of the sequence that contain non-digit, non-whitespace, or non-separator characters or that are empty are ignored.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified string.
member.param: The string containing the range of page numbers.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.Add(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a single page number to the sequence.
member.param: The page number.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.Add(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Adds a range of page numbers to the sequence. Reverse ordering is accepted.
member.param: The start page number of the range. If value is null, range is considered an open range from 1 to .
The end page number of the range. If value is null, range is considered an open range from to final page.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a range of page numbers to the sequence from a string representation (e.g. 1-5, 8, 11-13).
member.param: The string containing the range of page numbers.
member.remarks:
The range is specified as a string in the following forms or combination thereof:
5 single value 1,2,3,4,5 sequence of values 1-5 closed range -5 open range (converted to a sequence from 1 to 5) 1- open range (converted to a sequence from 1 to final page) all keyword representing all page numbers. odd keyword representing odd page numbers. even keyword representing even page numbers.
The value delimiter can be either ',' or ';' and the range separator can be either '-' or ':'. Whitespace is permitted at any point in the input.
Any elements of the sequence that contain non-digit, non-whitespace, or non-separator characters or that are empty are ignored.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.EnumeratePageNumbers(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enumerates all the page numbers that this range instance describes. The sequence will be distinct and in ascending order.
member.param: The final page number which is used as the maximum value for open range specifier.
member.returns: An enumerable sequence of integers. The sequence will be distinct and in ascending order

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.ToString
member.summary: Converts this instance to a string containing the range of page numbers.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.op_Implicit(System.String)~GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange
member.summary: Converts a string containing the range of page numbers to a .
member.param: A that contains the range of page numbers.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.op_Implicit(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange)~System.String
member.summary: Converts a to a string containing the range of page numbers.
member.param: A instance.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string containing the range of page numbers to a .
member.param: A that contains the range of page numbers.

member.summary: Represents a set of watermark options used for document conversion.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the watermark is horizontally aligned relative to a document page.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the watermark is vertically aligned relative to a document page.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.HorizontalDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance from left, right or center of document page; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) if is set to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.VerticalDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical distance from top, bottom or center of document page; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height) if is set to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.DistanceIsPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to handle and values. If true, is a percentage of the page width (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) and is a percentage of the page height (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height). If false, and are measured in points.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the watermark; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) if is set to true. If also is specified, the resulting width may be smaller than the given one to maintain the aspect ratio. For text watermaks, only percentage values are accepted after setting to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the watermark; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height) if is set to true. If also is specified, the resulting height may be smaller than the given one to maintain the aspect ratio. For text watermaks, only percentage values are accepted after setting to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.SizeIsPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to handle and values. If true, is a percentage of the page width (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) and is a percentage of the page height (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height). If false, and are measured in points.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle in degrees of the watermark.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the watermark. Default is 100. Values are between 0 and 100. Value 0 is invisible, value 100 is fully visible.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.InBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be added as a background layer to a document page. Default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.AnnotationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be added as an annotation to a document page. Default is false. will not work with annotation mode. Note that enabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be enabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.PrintVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be displayed when printed. Default is true. Note that disabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be disabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.ScreenVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be displayed on screen. Default is true. Note that disabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be disabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.PageRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of page numbers to add the watermark to. Default is "all". A string representation of number ranges (e.g. 1-5, 8, 11-13) or keywords (all, even, odd) can be directly assigned to this property.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache
member.summary: Provides methods for handling caching of documents.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentUltimateConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with custom configuration.
member.param: The configuration to use instead of the global configuration.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.EncryptionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether encryption of documents should be enabled. The default is true. Document viewer downloads a special document format on the client-side but for additional security (DRM), the document is also encypted by default.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.GetCacheInfo(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark})
member.summary: Gets the cache info for a document. This method can be used if you need to know the cache keys beforehand without calling method. Note that if the document source is not a physical file and is set to true or PDF file does not exist yet, this method will also copy the source to the cache folder before returning so that the conversion chain Source -> PDF -> XPZ can happen.
member.param: The document to generate cache info for.
The text or image watermarks to embed to the displayed document.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.GetOrAddPdf(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo)
member.summary: Gets or adds the PDF cache file. This method handles the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF. Normally you would not need to call this method directly because calling only method handles the conversion chain Source -> PDF -> XPZ.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.GetOrAddXpz(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo)
member.summary: Gets or adds the XPZ cache file. This method handles the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ. Normally you would not need to call this method directly because calling only method handles the conversion chain Source -> PDF -> XPZ.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.PreCacheDocument(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark})
member.summary: Pre-caches a document. Normally the source document is converted to a special web-friendly format and cached after the document viewer is displayed in the page and when the document is viewed for the first time. With this method, you can do the conversion and caching beforehand so this way, when a user opens the document for the first time, there will be no waiting and the document will be loaded immediately from the cache. If the source document is already converted and cached, then this method will do nothing and return the existing cached item.
member.param: The document to pre-cache.
The text or image watermarks to embed to the displayed document.
member.returns: A instance for the cached XPZ file, this object contains information like cache key.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo
member.summary: Represents the cache information for a document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheSourceKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for the source. This is the parent key and is unique for a document. This key is used in subfolder names in the cache folder to group outputs for the same input.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheSourceCopyKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for the source copy. If the document source is not a physical file, a copy of it may be made in the cache folder. This key corresponds to this cache item. This is null for physical files.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo.CachePdfKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for PDF. This key corresponds to the cache item which is the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF. This format is used both as an input to XPZ and as the file for "Download as PDF" button.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheXpzKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for XPZ. This key corresponds to the cache item which is the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ. This format is the web-friendly format used by the DocumentViewer.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource
member.summary: Defines a document that can be loaded either from a file on disk, a stream or a byte array.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document file.
member.param: The path to the document to load. Both physical (eg. c:\document.docx) and virtual (eg. /document.docx or ~/document.docx) paths are supported.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.#ctor(System.Func{System.IO.Stream},System.String,System.Int64,System.DateTime,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document stream. When you don't have a file on disk but you have a stream, you should use this constructor.
member.param: The callback method to return an opened stream containing the document. The stream is not required to be seekable because it will be immediately copied to cache folder if not already exists. This callback will only be called when necessary, i.e. if the stream is already cached before or if the required conversions are already done and cached before then the callback will not be called. The reason this is implemented as a callback rather than a direct instance is for extra performance, consider opening a stream is costly in your implementation, for example you are retrieving it from network or a database or even from a zip file so opening the stream only when it's really necessary would be more performant when your document is viewed several times by several users.

The name of the file (e.g. Document.docx, Document.pdf). The extension is required for determining the document format of the stream and also for generating a proper cache key for uniquely identifying streams. This file name will be also used for downloading if is not specified.
The size of the file. This is required for generating a proper cache key for uniquely identifying streams.
The last modified time of the file. This is required for generating a proper cache key for uniquely identifying streams.
Whether to leave the stream (returned by callback) open after the copying is complete.

Whether to keep the copied stream in cache folder even after it is converted to a web-friendly format. If set to false, "Download" button will be disabled ("Download as PDF" button will be still available) because the viewer will not know how to access your original stream if it's not cached. For example if you are using property then you will not need to keep a copy of the original stream in cache so you can set this to false in that case.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.#ctor(System.Func{System.Byte[]},System.String,System.Int64,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document data. When you don't have a file on disk or a stream, you should use this constructor.
member.param: The callback method to return a byte array containing the document. This data will be immediately copied to cache folder if not already exists. This callback will only be called when necessary, i.e. if the data is already cached before or if the required conversions are already done and cached before then the callback will not be called. The reason this is implemented as a callback rather than a direct instance is for extra performance, consider retrieving the data is costly in your implementation, for example you are retrieving it from network or a database or even from a zip file so retrieving the data only when it's really necessary would be more performant when your document is viewed several times by several users.

The name of the file (e.g. Document.docx, Document.pdf). The extension is required for determining the document format of the data and also for generating a proper cache key for uniquely identifying data. This file name will be also used for downloading if is not specified.
The size of the file. This is required for generating a proper cache key for uniquely identifying data.
The last modified time of the file. This is required for generating a proper cache key for uniquely identifying data.

Whether to keep the copied data in cache folder even after it is converted to a web-friendly format. If set to false, "Download" button will be disabled ("Download as PDF" button will be still available) because the viewer will not know how to access your original data if it's not cached. For example if you are using property then you will not need to keep a copy of the original data in cache so you can set this to false in that case.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.Name
member.summary: Gets the file name of the document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.Size
member.summary: Gets the file size of the document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.DateModified
member.summary: Gets the file last modified date of the document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.PhysicalPath
member.summary: Gets the physical file path of the document. The value is null if this instance is not created with constructor.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password which is used for loading a protected document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.CopyToStream
member.summary: Gets the function for copying document data to a target stream. The value is null if this instance is not created from a stream or a byte array.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.KeepSourceCached
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether to keep the copied data in cache folder.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.ToString
member.summary: Converts this instance to a string containing a document path (if initialized from a file).

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.op_Implicit(System.String)~GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource
member.summary: Converts a string containing a document path to a .
member.param: A that contains the document path.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.op_Implicit(GleamTech.IO.BackSlashPath)~GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource
member.summary: Converts a containing a document path to a .
member.param: A that contains the document path.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.op_Implicit(GleamTech.IO.ForwardSlashPath)~GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource
member.summary: Converts a containing a document path to a .
member.param: A that contains the document path.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.op_Implicit(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource)~System.String
member.summary: Converts a to a string containing a document path (if initialized from a file).
member.param: A instance.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string containing a document path to a .
member.param: A that contains the document path.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer
member.summary: The control for viewing several formats of documents.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with custom configuration.
member.param: The web configuration to use instead of the global web configuration.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the control.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the control.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.FullViewport
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies if the control should fit the browser's viewport (interior of the browser window). When set to true, and properties will be discarded.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.Resizable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies if the control can be resized when the user drags sides.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.ResizeHandles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the handles which can be used for resizing the control.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.DownloadUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the custom url that should be used for downloading. By default, when you click the download button, the download is handled internally by the control. You can override the default behaviour by specifying your own url which handles the download.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.DownloadFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the custom file name used for downloading. This property will override the original file name specified in .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.DownloadEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether downloading the original document should be enabled. The default is true. Downloading can be disabled for security (DRM) purpose.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.DownloadAsPdfEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether downloading a PDF version of the original document should be enabled. The default is true. Downloading as PDF can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.PrintEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether printing the displayed document should be enabled. The default is true. Printing can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.TextSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether selecting text in the displayed document should be enabled.The default is true. Text selection can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.ToolbarVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the top toolbar is visible. The default is true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.SidePaneVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the left side pane is visible. The default is true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the display language of the control.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.LoadingMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the message displayed while the document is being prepared for the first-time viewing. For example, you can override the default message for localization purpose.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.HighlightedKeywords
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the keywords to be highlighted when the document is displayed. For example, if you launch the document viewer from a search results page, you can pass the searched keywords.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.Watermarks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the text or image watermarks to embed to the displayed document. Downloading as PDF will also include the same watermarks.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.Document
member.summary: Gets or sets the document to load and display.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.GetLinkTags
member.summary: Gets link tags of the control.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.GetScriptTags
member.summary: Gets script tags of the control.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentViewer.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders the control.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for changing this library's configuration for web use.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with custom configuration.
member.param: The configuration to use instead of the global configuration.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CachePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to store cached documents. Value can be a virtual or physical path, however always returns a physical path, ie. if the original value was a virtual path, returns the resolved physical path.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheMaxDays
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days to store cached documents. The default value is 90 days.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.EncryptionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether encryption of documents should be enabled. The default is true. Document viewer downloads a special document format on the client-side but for additional security (DRM), the document is also encypted by default.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.DocumentViewerHandlerPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the path for the document viewer handler (eg. documentviewer.ashx). Normally you would not need to change the default value.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.InitCurrent
member.summary: Initializes only the static Current instance.

member.summary: Gets current global configuration instance.

member.summary: Runs automatically before the ASP.NET application is started.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.RestoreRoutes
member.summary: Restores the necessary routes in case you cleared RouteTable.Routes in your application.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter
member.summary: Provides methods for converting between document file formats.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.#ctor(GleamTech.IO.BackSlashPath,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.InputOptions,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentUltimateConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a document file.
member.param: The path to the document file to convert.
The input options which contains format and other options for the file to be converted.
The configuration to use instead of the global configuration.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.CanConvertTo(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a direct conversion is possible to the specified format.
member.param: The format to convert to.
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.CanConvertTo(GleamTech.IO.BackSlashPath,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a direct conversion is possible to the specified file.
member.param: The file name or path or extension (with or without leading dot) of the converted document file.
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.ConvertTo(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Converts the document file to another format. The converted file be generated in the same folder as the source file and the extension will be automatically determined from .
member.param: The target format to convert the document file to.
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.
member.returns: A object that contains the result of the document conversion such as output file paths.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.ConvertTo(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.OutputOptions,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Converts the document file to another format. The converted file be generated in the same folder as the source file and the extension will be automatically determined from .
member.param: The output options which contains format and other options for the converted file.
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.
member.returns: A object that contains the result of the document conversion such as output file paths.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.ConvertTo(GleamTech.IO.BackSlashPath,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Converts a given document file to another format with the specified output path and format.
member.param: The path to the converted document file.
The target format to convert the document file to.
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.
member.returns: A object that contains the result of the document conversion such as output file paths.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.ConvertTo(GleamTech.IO.BackSlashPath,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.OutputOptions,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Converts a given document file to another format with the specified output path and options.
member.param: The path to the converted document file.
The output options which contains format and other options for the converted file. If not specified, the format will be automatically determined from the file extension in .
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.
member.returns: A object that contains the result of the document conversion such as output file paths.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.CanConvert(GleamTech.IO.BackSlashPath,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a direct conversion is possible from one document file to another format.
member.param: The file name or path or extension (with or without leading dot) of the document file to convert.
The format to convert to.
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.CanConvert(GleamTech.IO.BackSlashPath,GleamTech.IO.BackSlashPath,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a direct conversion is possible from one document file to another file.
member.param: The file name or path or extension (with or without leading dot) of the document file to convert.
The file name or path or extension (with or without leading dot) of the converted document file.
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.CanConvert(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngineEnforcement)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a direct conversion is possible from one document format to another format.
member.param: The format to convert from
The format to convert to.
The document engine enforcement option. If not specified, either the native or managed document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.
